title-group.article-title: Experimental Investigations to Fully Map The Flow Field Around A Wind Tunnel Model of A Transport Airplane

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1981 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: A description of the results of research conducted to fully map the three-dimensional flow field associated with a typical transport airplane. Details of the method employed to map the flow field, pictures of the longitudinal development of forebody vortices, and a comparison of the experimental results with empirical methods are presented. The results also include a graphic description of the wake propagation behind deflected spoiler panels.

ref.mixed-citation: Mack, M.D., Seetharam, LLC., Kuhn, W. G., and Bright, J. T., Aerodynamics of Spoiler Control Devices, AIAA Paper No. 79-1 873, August 1 979.
Seetharam, H.C., and Wentz, W.H., Jr., Experimental Studies of Flow Separation and Stalling of a Two- Dimensional Airfoil at Low Speeds, NASA CR-2560, July 1975.
Seetharam, H.C., and Wentz, W.H., Jr., A Low Speed Two-Dimensional Study of Flow Separation on the GA(W)-1 Airfoil with 30 Percent Chord Fowler Flap, NASA CR-2844, May 1977.
USAF DA TCOM Section 4.313, "Wing Body Lift in the Nonlinear Angle-of-Attack Range;" Section 5.3.1.2, "Tail-Body Side-Force Coefficient Cy at Angle of Attack."
